result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Earl Lawson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; AS TO BOTH COUNTS

superMiscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample; pay the related surcharge. Pay all court costs and victim/witness surcharges to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 06-09-2029; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Employment or school.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
- Successfully complete a Parenting Program. 
- No contact with Purvis F.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Earl Lawson in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Robert Earl Lawson in custody.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 9 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/9/2029; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/9/2029; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-No contact with Purvis F.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Robert Earl Lawson in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
State needs to do victim notification. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/9/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court, defendant Robert Earl Lawson not in court, in custody.  Karen A Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 6/5/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Debra J Patterson in court.  Karyn E Behling appeared for Karen Ann Loebel for the State of Wisconsin. Defense have not received and offer. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 15. Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Robert Earl Lawson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Robert Earl Lawson in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Daniel P or Purvis F

Defendant Robert Earl Lawson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Robert Earl Lawson in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
